name: Series-organiser
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
tagline: A small program to enforce filename consistency in downloaded series
body:
![image](http://i.imgur.com/ifNtS.png)

### Overview
This is a small program that I wrote during my first year of study. Often I found my series folders to be a complete mess, with episodes out of order due to discrepancies in naming conventions by group uploaders. Initially the program was very limited, and a lot of testing was needed to make the algorithm robust. Now it handles a wide-variety of input formats.

Soon to be updated to version 2! All code has been rewritten from scratch and a whole bunch of new features will be added! [COMING SOON] 

### Feature List

* Quickly organise series on a season-by-season basis, forcing filenames to correspond to a format of your choosing
* Dynamic preview let's you see the end result change as you edit the output format
* Rollback feature
* Context-menu integration[BETA/WIP]

Change log

v2.0
-coming soon!

v0.6b

-Program renamed to Series Organiser

-vastly improved support for anime by addressing common anime naming conventions

-removed context-menu integration for now

-minor bug fixes

V0.53b

-Added support for context menus in windows explorer[BETA]

-Temporarily removed Preserve episode name functionality due to a massive bug

V0.52b

-Removed a nag screen caused by incorrect detection of season numbers

-Improved aesthetics of default output format. The “s” denoting season and “e” denoting episode are now capital letters

-Added support for .mov files

V0.51b

-fixed a bug where key numbers right at the end of a file name would crash the program

-added support for .m4v and .flv files

-fixed a bug where name detection would break when key numbers were missing

-The file dialog now has “memory”

-Both files and folders are now displayed in the file dialog. Selection of any file in a folder will tell the program to point to the parent folder of the file

V0.5b

-Improved program robustness when stray numbers are present in episode names

-Added greater support for series that have no season numbers in their episode names

-Improved program behaviour when dialog windows receive “cancel” responses

-Preview frame is no longer resizable

-The original file name is now shown when using the edit function of the preview window

-Fixed strange behaviour with the panels in the preview window

-Fixed preserve names functionality once again, still not ideal for HD series*

-Program now automatically detects the name of the series

V0.4b

-beta release

-restored preserve names functionality, optimised code slightly

V0.34a

-fixed a bug where video files without any numbers in their filename would break the program

-fixed an issue where HD markers would be lost upon conversion

-scrollbars in the preview window are now always synchronised

V0.33a

-fixed a bug where clicking cancel in the edit pane would corrupt the edited filename

v0.32a

-fixed a huge bug where misc. files that weren't at the end of the file list broke the program

-cleaned up layout

-created proper readme

v0.31a

-minor bug fixes

-edit button added

v0.3a

-revisited project

-added preview mode

v0.21a

-fixed a bug where misc. files in the folder would break the algorithm

v0.2a

-added option to retain file names

-added basic support for HD, blu-ray and x264 formats

v0.1a

-initial release
